overview: "...a very funny Bohemian party is depicted chronologically, intercut with a series of very unfunny conversations between pairs of young homosexuals (three sets, as I made it out, in various combinations). Catullus Silent, however, has none of that stylish sadistic menace toward the audience; it is rather sad than angry." - Student Film-Making: First Report, Jackson Burgess. Film Quarterly, 1966
title: Catullus Silent
